comments.author: Anne
comments.content: Michael, where do you stand on the issue of eating veggie food fried in the same oil that's fried fish? It doesn't bother me, but I wonder if you noticed any fish flavor. Sounds like you had a yummy dinner!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey Anne - yeah, personally I don't worry about it unless the taste offends
me. They didn't kill a fish for me to eat, it just incidentally touched the
same oil, so I don't stress about it. Actually I think Pike St. might be
keeping a separate fryer for vegetable dishes, though I didn't ask... kinda
looked that way to me. Anyone in the know? That would be a rare but nice
level of concern!

comments.author: The Other Tiger
comments.content: Sounds pretty tasty.  My husband got really interested once I mentioned the fried green beans.  We're looking for good places to get a reasonable vegetarian lunch in the downtown-ish area, so we'll have to try it out next week.  Thanks for the tip!

comments.author: Kate
comments.content: Makes me wish I lived in Seattle. That looks delicious. I totally agree about the "great indulgence occasionally" rather than "mediocre ones constantly."
